document_metadata.subject: Basic Policy Plan of the Convention - Nobel Charitable Trust Earth Environment Convention

organizations: GSSI Earth Environment Technology Development Expo Executive Committee
National Congress of Parents & Teachers Association of Japan
General Administrative Agency of the Cabinet
Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology
Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry
Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communication
Appeal of the Peace Prize Laureates Foundation
locations: Tokyo Big Sight (Tokyo International Exhibition Center)

connections.nature: Michael Nobel and other Nobel family members are founders and directors

connections.entity2: GSSI Earth Environment Technology Development Expo Executive Committee
connections.nature: GSSI committee manages all production and operations of the convention
High-profile figures lending credibility and visibility to the event

relationships_and_connections.power_dynamics: Nobel Charitable Trust holds authority over awards and accreditation, with Michael Nobel and family members in leadership positions overseeing the entire operation

transactions: Funding from NCT for convention costs

content_analysis.purpose: To outline the comprehensive plan for hosting the Nobel Charitable Trust Earth Environment Convention in 2012, including logistics, programming, and operational details
content_analysis.significance: Detailed blueprint for a major international environmental convention with high-profile participants and ambitious goals to establish NCT as a prestigious environmental accreditation body

notable_quotes: "NCT aims to gain worldwide recognition and establish the NCT accreditation mark as the world's most prestigious environmental accreditation mark."
"Awarded products will enjoy high status and recognition as a product accredited by the prestigious Nobel Charitable Trust, giving it a significant advantage in expanding its market."
"Despite the many environmental conferences taking place around the world, no event has ever included an exhibition of environmental technologies."
